title: Amulet/ru
data:
| **[Item](/wiki/Item "Item") classes**          |                                        |   |
| ---------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------- | - |
| [" Amulets](/wiki/Amulet "Amulet")             | [\[ Armor](/wiki/Armor "Armor")        |   |
| [% Comestibles](/wiki/Comestible "Comestible") | [$ Coins](/wiki/Coin "Coin")           |   |
| [\* Gems](/wiki/Gem "Gem")                     | [! Potions](/wiki/Potion "Potion")     |   |
| [= Rings](/wiki/Ring "Ring")                   | [? Scrolls](/wiki/Scroll "Scroll")     |   |
| [+ Spellbooks](/wiki/Spellbook "Spellbook")    | [\` Statues](/wiki/Statue "Statue")    |   |
| [( Tools](/wiki/Tool "Tool")                   | [\` Boulders](/wiki/Boulder "Boulder") |   |
| [) Weapons](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon")             | [/ Wands](/wiki/Wand "Wand")           |   |

**Амулет** это [вещь](/wiki/Item "Item") которую персонаж может [надеть](/wiki/Put_on "Put on") на шею. Надевшему его обычно дается магическая сила, но, например, [амулет удушения](/wiki/Amulet_of_strangulation "Amulet of strangulation") может быть опасен. Амулеты обозначаются двойными кавычками: ". Это также команда для отображения надетого на вас амулета.

**[English](/wiki/Amulet "Amulet")**

 • [русский]()

 • [中文（中国大陆）‎](/wiki/Amulet/zh-CN "Amulet/zh-CN")

Wearing any amulet will increase the rate at which you get [hungry](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition"), by an extra 1 nutrition per 20 turns.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) Carrying the Amulet of Yendor consumes an additional 1 nutrition per 20 turns, regardless of whether or not you are wearing it.

All amulets have a [weight](/wiki/Weight "Weight") of 20, are made of [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron"), and have a base price of 150 [zorkmids](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid"), with two exceptions: the Amulet of Yendor is made of [mithril](/wiki/Mithril "Mithril") and has a base price of 30000 zorkmids, and the [cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Cheap_plastic_imitation_of_the_Amulet_of_Yendor "Cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor") is made of [plastic](/wiki/Plastic "Plastic") and is worth 0 zorkmids.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Table of amulets](#Table_of_amulets)
- [2 Generation](#Generation)
- [3 Identification](#Identification)
  - [3.1 Probabilities and use-testing](#Probabilities_and_use-testing)
- [4 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [5 Encyclopaedia entry](#Encyclopaedia_entry)
- [6 References](#References)

## Table of amulets

| Amulet                                                                                                                                                     | Relative probability | Notes                                                      |
| ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------- |
| [amulet of change](/wiki/Amulet_of_change "Amulet of change")                                                                                              | 13%                  | 90.5% generated cursed, EAT                                |
| [amulet of ESP](/wiki/Amulet_of_ESP "Amulet of ESP")                                                                                                       | 17.5%                | EAT                                                        |
| [amulet of life saving](/wiki/Amulet_of_life_saving "Amulet of life saving")                                                                               | 7.5%                 |                                                            |
| [amulet of magical breathing](/wiki/Amulet_of_magical_breathing "Amulet of magical breathing")                                                             | 6.5%                 | EAT                                                        |
| [amulet of reflection](/wiki/Amulet_of_reflection "Amulet of reflection")                                                                                  | 7.5%                 |                                                            |
| [amulet of restful sleep](/wiki/Amulet_of_restful_sleep "Amulet of restful sleep")                                                                         | 13.5%                | 90.5% generated cursed, EAT                                |
| [amulet of strangulation](/wiki/Amulet_of_strangulation "Amulet of strangulation")                                                                         | 13.5%                | 90.5% generated cursed, EAT                                |
| [amulet of unchanging](/wiki/Amulet_of_unchanging "Amulet of unchanging")                                                                                  | 4.5%                 |                                                            |
| [amulet versus poison](/wiki/Amulet_versus_poison "Amulet versus poison")                                                                                  | 16.5%                | EAT                                                        |
|                                                                                                                                                            |                      |                                                            |
| [cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Cheap_plastic_imitation_of_the_Amulet_of_Yendor "Cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor") | 0                    |                                                            |
| [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor")                                                                                              | 0                    | will not fit in a [container](/wiki/Container "Container") |

Amulets marked EAT can be [eaten](/wiki/Eating_jewelry "Eating jewelry") for a 1/5 chance of obtaining their effect permanently (providing you are polymorphed into a [metallivore](/wiki/Metallivore "Metallivore")). Eating an amulet of unchanging will return you to your normal form. Other amulets can be eaten (except the fake Amulet which is made of plastic, and the real Amulet which is indestructible), but do not confer their effect.

## Generation

Amulets comprise 1% of all randomly-generated items in the main dungeon, 1% in containers, and 4% in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom"). The second column above is the relative probability of each subtype.

The ones generated 90.5% cursed are 9% uncursed and 0.5% blessed. All others are generated 5% cursed, 90% uncursed, 5% blessed.

The Amulet of Yendor is a [unique item](/wiki/Unique_item "Unique item") found only in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom"). Its fake counterpart is found only on the [Rogue level](/wiki/Rogue_level "Rogue level"), in the inventories of certain high-level monsters, and in the bones files of people who had a real or fake amulet themselves; the real amulet will be replaced with a fake one.

## Identification

All amulets cost 150[zm](/wiki/Zm "Zm") and weigh 20, so they cannot be distinguished using [price identification](/wiki/Price_identification "Price identification"). The appearance of the first 9 types of amulet in the table are [randomized](/wiki/Randomized_appearance "Randomized appearance") from the following descriptions:

```
circular    spherical   oval       
triangular  pyramidal   square 
concave     hexagonal   octagonal
```

Non-cursed amulets are safe to try on; the effect may become obvious after a while, such as for the amulet of ESP, and you can always remove it if it is strangulation or restful sleep. The only risk is a small chance at changing genders, which is not a debilitating issue for the most part.

Amulets of change and strangulation always formally identify themselves when worn. Every other amulet (other than the real and fake Amulets of Yendor) adds a line to the [enlightenment](/wiki/Enlightenment "Enlightenment") screen, although some lines can have other sources:

| Amulet of...      | produces the line...                         | Other sources                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| ----------------- | -------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| ESP               | "You are telepathic."                        | [Helm of telepathy](/wiki/Helm_of_telepathy "Helm of telepathy"), some quest artifacts, intrinsic                                                                                                                                 |
| life saving       | "Your life will be saved."                   | none                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| magical breathing | "You can survive without air."               | none                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| reflection        | "You have reflection."                       | silver [dragon scale mail](/wiki/Dragon_scale_mail "Dragon scale mail"), [shield of reflection](/wiki/Shield_of_reflection "Shield of reflection"), wielded [Longbow of Diana](/wiki/Longbow_of_Diana "Longbow of Diana")         |
| restful sleep     | "You fall asleep."                           | none                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| unchanging        | "You can not change from your current form." | none                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| versus poison     | "You are poison resistant."                  | green [dragon scale mail](/wiki/Dragon_scale_mail "Dragon scale mail"), [ring of poison resistance](/wiki/Ring_of_poison_resistance "Ring of poison resistance"), [alchemy smock](/wiki/Alchemy_smock "Alchemy smock"), intrinsic |

In addition, [intelligent](/wiki/Intelligent "Intelligent") monsters will only pick up and put on life saving (if living) and reflection.

Amulets of ESP can be identified using the [artifact naming trick](/wiki/Naming_artifacts "Naming artifacts"), because they cannot be named “[The Eye of the Aethiopica](/wiki/The_Eye_of_the_Aethiopica "The Eye of the Aethiopica")”.

The real Amulet of Yendor, unlike the fakes, cannot be placed in a container ("The Amulet of Yendor cannot be confined in such trappings.")

### Probabilities and use-testing

Usually, formal [identification](/wiki/Identification "Identification") or [enlightenment](/wiki/Enlightenment "Enlightenment") are better techniques to identify an amulet, but sometimes [conducts](/wiki/Conduct "Conduct") or scarce resources make you rely on relative probabilities, [pet testing](/wiki/Pet_testing "Pet testing"), and indirect clues.

| Amulet of...      | Prob. when not cursed, non-ESP                                     | when cursed, non-ESP | Ways to identify, wear-testing                                                                                                                                                                        |
| ----------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------ | -------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Change            | 1.6%                                                               | 30.7%                | Autoidentifies                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| ESP               | [Artifact naming trick](/wiki/Naming_artifacts "Naming artifacts") |                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| Life saving       | 16.8%                                                              | 1.0%                 | Monster use, [Vlad's Tower](/wiki/Vlad%27s_Tower#Middle_level "Vlad's Tower")                                                                                                                         |
| Magical breathing | 14.5%                                                              | 0.8%                 | Go into [water](/wiki/Pool "Pool"), e.g. after digging on [fountain](/wiki/Fountain "Fountain")                                                                                                       |
| Reflection        | 16.8%                                                              | 1.0%                 | Bounce a [ray](/wiki/Ray "Ray") onto yourself, [Sokoban](/wiki/Sokoban "Sokoban") prize, monster use                                                                                                  |
| Restful sleep     | 1.7%                                                               | 31.9%                | Wear for 100 turns unless [sleep resistant](/wiki/Sleep_resistant "Sleep resistant")                                                                                                                  |
| Strangulation     | 1.7%                                                               | 31.9%                | [Vlad's Tower](/wiki/Vlad%27s_Tower#Middle_level "Vlad's Tower"), autoidentifies                                                                                                                      |
| Unchanging        | 10.1%                                                              | 0.6%                 | [Eat](/wiki/Eat "Eat") a [mimic](/wiki/Mimic "Mimic"), attempt [controlled](/wiki/Polymorph_control "Polymorph control") [polyself](/wiki/Polyself "Polyself"), or get [slimed](/wiki/Slime "Slime"). |
| Versus poison     | 36.9%                                                              | 2.2%                 | Elimination. Unless resistant, eat poisonous [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse"). Non-healers quaff [sickness](/wiki/Potion_of_sickness "Potion of sickness") even if resistant.                          |

Above are the probabilities for the various types of amulet, on condition its cursedness is known and it is not ESP. The latter is excluded because ESP can always be tested for, instantly, even before curse-testing.

Some players are opposed to the artifact naming trick. They can wear-test for ESP by far-looking at a nearby brainy monster. 27.3% of all non-cursed and 2.2% of all cursed amulets are ESP.

## Strategy

Amulets cannot be destroyed by electric [shocks](/wiki/Shock "Shock"), so unless stolen by a [nymph](/wiki/Nymph "Nymph") or [monkey](/wiki/Monkey "Monkey") they are reliable at conferring their effect.

## Encyclopaedia entry

"The complete Amulet can keep off all the things that make  
people unhappy -- jealousy, bad temper, pride, disagreeableness,  
greediness, selfishness, laziness. Evil spirits, people called  
them when the Amulet was made. Don't you think it would be nice  
to have it?"  
"Very," said the children, quite without enthusiasm.  
"And it can give you strength and courage."  
"That's better," said Cyril.  
"And virtue."  
"I suppose it's nice to have that," said Jane, but not with much  
interest.  
"And it can give you your heart's desire."  
"Now you're talking," said Robert.

\[ The Story of the Amulet, by Edith Nesbit ]

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [gethungry](/wiki/Source:Eat.c#gethungry "Source:Eat.c") in [eat.c](/wiki/Source:Eat.c "Source:Eat.c")

*This page is based on a spoiler by [Dylan O'Donnell](https://alt.org/nethack/mirror/www.spod-central.org/%257Epsmith/). The original license is:*

Redistribution, copying, and editing of these spoilers, with or without modification, are permitted provided that the following conditions are met:

1. The original contributors to any spoiler must continue to be credited.
2. Any modifications to the spoiler must be acknowledged and credited.

[![This article may require revision for the next version of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/b/b0/Nh343-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-343}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.

Amulet/ru

From NetHackWiki
< Amulet
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Item classes
" Amulets [ Armor
% Comestibles $ Coins
* Gems ! Potions
= Rings ? Scrolls
+ Spellbooks ` Statues
( Tools ` Boulders
) Weapons / Wands

Амулет это вещь которую персонаж может надеть на шею. Надевшему его обычно дается магическая сила, но, например, амулет удушения может быть опасен. Амулеты обозначаются двойными кавычками: ". Это также команда для отображения надетого на вас амулета.

English

 • русский

 • 中文（中国大陆）‎

Wearing any amulet will increase the rate at which you get hungry, by an extra 1 nutrition per 20 turns.[1] Carrying the Amulet of Yendor consumes an additional 1 nutrition per 20 turns, regardless of whether or not you are wearing it.

All amulets have a weight of 20, are made of iron, and have a base price of 150 zorkmids, with two exceptions: the Amulet of Yendor is made of mithril and has a base price of 30000 zorkmids, and the cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor is made of plastic and is worth 0 zorkmids.

Contents

  • 1 Table of amulets
  • 2 Generation
  • 3 Identification
    • 3.1 Probabilities and use-testing
  • 4 Strategy
  • 5 Encyclopaedia entry
  • 6 References

Table of amulets

Amulet Relative probability Notes
amulet of change 13% 90.5% generated cursed, EAT
amulet of ESP 17.5% EAT
amulet of life saving 7.5%
amulet of magical breathing 6.5% EAT
amulet of reflection 7.5%
amulet of restful sleep 13.5% 90.5% generated cursed, EAT
amulet of strangulation 13.5% 90.5% generated cursed, EAT
amulet of unchanging 4.5%
amulet versus poison 16.5% EAT
cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor 0
Amulet of Yendor 0 will not fit in a container

Amulets marked EAT can be eaten for a 1/5 chance of obtaining their effect permanently (providing you are polymorphed into a metallivore). Eating an amulet of unchanging will return you to your normal form. Other amulets can be eaten (except the fake Amulet which is made of plastic, and the real Amulet which is indestructible), but do not confer their effect.

Generation

Amulets comprise 1% of all randomly-generated items in the main dungeon, 1% in containers, and 4% in Gehennom. The second column above is the relative probability of each subtype.

The ones generated 90.5% cursed are 9% uncursed and 0.5% blessed. All others are generated 5% cursed, 90% uncursed, 5% blessed.

The Amulet of Yendor is a unique item found only in Gehennom. Its fake counterpart is found only on the Rogue level, in the inventories of certain high-level monsters, and in the bones files of people who had a real or fake amulet themselves; the real amulet will be replaced with a fake one.

Identification

All amulets cost 150zm and weigh 20, so they cannot be distinguished using price identification. The appearance of the first 9 types of amulet in the table are randomized from the following descriptions: 

circular    spherical   oval       
triangular  pyramidal   square 
concave     hexagonal   octagonal

Non-cursed amulets are safe to try on; the effect may become obvious after a while, such as for the amulet of ESP, and you can always remove it if it is strangulation or restful sleep. The only risk is a small chance at changing genders, which is not a debilitating issue for the most part.

Amulets of change and strangulation always formally identify themselves when worn. Every other amulet (other than the real and fake Amulets of Yendor) adds a line to the enlightenment screen, although some lines can have other sources:

Amulet of... produces the line... Other sources
ESP "You are telepathic." Helm of telepathy, some quest artifacts, intrinsic
life saving "Your life will be saved." none
magical breathing "You can survive without air." none
reflection "You have reflection." silver dragon scale mail, shield of reflection, wielded Longbow of Diana
restful sleep "You fall asleep." none
unchanging "You can not change from your current form." none
versus poison "You are poison resistant." green dragon scale mail, ring of poison resistance, alchemy smock, intrinsic

In addition, intelligent monsters will only pick up and put on life saving (if living) and reflection.

Amulets of ESP can be identified using the artifact naming trick, because they cannot be named “The Eye of the Aethiopica”.

The real Amulet of Yendor, unlike the fakes, cannot be placed in a container ("The Amulet of Yendor cannot be confined in such trappings.")

Probabilities and use-testing

Usually, formal identification or enlightenment are better techniques to identify an amulet, but sometimes conducts or scarce resources make you rely on relative probabilities, pet testing, and indirect clues.

Amulet of... Prob. when not cursed, non-ESP when cursed, non-ESP Ways to identify, wear-testing
Change 1.6% 30.7% Autoidentifies
ESP Artifact naming trick
Life saving 16.8% 1.0% Monster use, Vlad's Tower
Magical breathing 14.5% 0.8% Go into water, e.g. after digging on fountain
Reflection 16.8% 1.0% Bounce a ray onto yourself, Sokoban prize, monster use
Restful sleep 1.7% 31.9% Wear for 100 turns unless sleep resistant
Strangulation 1.7% 31.9% Vlad's Tower, autoidentifies
Unchanging 10.1% 0.6% Eat a mimic, attempt controlled polyself, or get slimed.
Versus poison 36.9% 2.2% Elimination. Unless resistant, eat poisonous corpse. Non-healers quaff sickness even if resistant.

Above are the probabilities for the various types of amulet, on condition its cursedness is known and it is not ESP. The latter is excluded because ESP can always be tested for, instantly, even before curse-testing.

Some players are opposed to the artifact naming trick. They can wear-test for ESP by far-looking at a nearby brainy monster. 27.3% of all non-cursed and 2.2% of all cursed amulets are ESP.

Strategy

Amulets cannot be destroyed by electric shocks, so unless stolen by a nymph or monkey they are reliable at conferring their effect.

Encyclopaedia entry

"The complete Amulet can keep off all the things that make
people unhappy -- jealousy, bad temper, pride, disagreeableness,
greediness, selfishness, laziness. Evil spirits, people called
them when the Amulet was made. Don't you think it would be nice
to have it?"
"Very," said the children, quite without enthusiasm.
"And it can give you strength and courage."
"That's better," said Cyril.
"And virtue."
"I suppose it's nice to have that," said Jane, but not with much
interest.
"And it can give you your heart's desire."
"Now you're talking," said Robert.

[ The Story of the Amulet, by Edith Nesbit ]

References

  1. ↑ gethungry in eat.c

{{items}}
'''Амулет''' это [[item|вещь]] которую персонаж может [[put on|надеть]] на шею. Надевшему его обычно дается магическая сила, но, например, [[amulet of strangulation|амулет удушения]] может быть опасен. Амулеты обозначаются двойными кавычками: {{cyan|"}}. Это также команда для отображения надетого на вас амулета.

{{Languages}}
Wearing any amulet will increase the rate at which you get [[nutrition|hungry]], by an extra 1 nutrition per 20 turns.{{reffunc|eat.c|gethungry}} Carrying the Amulet of Yendor consumes an additional 1 nutrition per 20 turns, regardless of whether or not you are wearing it.

| 16.8%
| 1.0%
| Monster use, [[Vlad's_Tower#Middle_level|Vlad's Tower]]
|-
|Magical breathing
| 14.5%
| 0.8%
| Go into [[pool|water]], e.g. after digging on [[fountain]]
|-
|Reflection
| 16.8%
| 1.0%
| Bounce a [[ray]] onto yourself, [[Sokoban]] prize, monster use
|-
|Restful sleep
| 1.7%
| 31.9%
| Wear for 100 turns unless [[sleep resistant]]
|-
|Strangulation
| 1.7%
| 31.9%
| [[Vlad's_Tower#Middle_level|Vlad's Tower]], autoidentifies
|-
|Unchanging
| 10.1%
| 0.6%
| [[Eat]] a [[mimic]], attempt [[polymorph control|controlled]] [[polyself]], or get [[slime]]d.
|-
|Versus poison
| 36.9%
| 2.2%
| Elimination. Unless resistant, eat poisonous [[corpse]]. Non-healers quaff [[potion of sickness|sickness]] even if resistant.
|}

Above are the probabilities for the various types of amulet, on condition its cursedness is known and it is not ESP. The latter is excluded because ESP can always be tested for, instantly, even before curse-testing.

Some players are opposed to the artifact naming trick. They can wear-test for ESP by far-looking at a nearby brainy monster. 27.3% of all non-cursed and 2.2% of all cursed amulets are ESP.

==Strategy==

Amulets cannot be destroyed by electric [[shock]]s, so unless stolen by a [[nymph]] or [[monkey]] they are reliable at conferring their effect.

==Encyclopaedia entry==

{{encyclopedia|
"The complete Amulet can keep off all the things that make
people unhappy -- jealousy, bad temper, pride, disagreeableness,
greediness, selfishness, laziness.  Evil spirits, people called
them when the Amulet was made.  Don't you think it would be nice
to have it?"
"Very," said the children, quite without enthusiasm.
"And it can give you strength and courage."
"That's better," said Cyril.
"And virtue."
"I suppose it's nice to have that," said Jane, but not with much
interest.
"And it can give you your heart's desire."
"Now you're talking," said Robert.
|[ The Story of the Amulet, by Edith Nesbit ]
}}
